msContents.summary: Two leaves used as flyleaves in the binding of P. Fonseca’s commentary on Aristotle’s Metaphysics (Commentariorum Petri Fonsecae Lvsitani, Doctoris Theologi Societatis Iesu, in Libros Mataphysicorum Aristotelis Stagiritae, tomus primus, Frankfurt: Ioannes Saurius, 1599). Both leaves are fragmentary; the verso of the leaf at the front of the book and the recto of the leaf at the back of the book are badly rubbed and largely unreadable.

msItem.title: Earlier Version of the Wycliffite Bible
msItem.note: The leaf at the front contains Deuteronomy 21:1–23:4; the leaf at the back used to follow it in the original manuscript and contains 23:4–25:11.

No evidence of marginal glosses; apparently a correction in the first line of the first column of the recto of the leaf at the front; added material within the text is not underlined. Plain red 2- or 3-line initials at the beginnings of chapters; running titles in red on both rectos and versos, consisting of an abbreviated title of the book without a chapter number.

layoutDesc.layout: ruled for two columns; over 40 lines per page

origin.p:
Dialect survey:
puple(2), wijf(2), lijf(1), self(1), yuel(1), synneþ(1), puniȝsshinge(1), land(2), blood(2), ȝif(5)
-iþ(2)/-eþ(2) (pres.ind.3sg.), -en(2) (pres.ind.pl.), -yng(2)/-ing(1) (pres.part.), hem(4) (3pl.pronoun, oblique), sheo(8) (3sg.fem.pronoun, nom.)

history.provenance:
Inscription on flyleaf: 3º July 1634
Liber Aulae Gloucestrensis ex dono Johannis Goodridge in Artibus Magistri, et hujus Aulae quondam Commensalis. Foster, J., Alumni Oxonienses: the members of the University of Oxford, 1500–1714, 4 vols (London: Joseph Foster; Oxford: Parker and Co., 1891–92), p. 583, lists John Goodridge of Devon who matriculated at Balliol College in 1597/8 and received an MA from Gloucester Hall in 1606, but the date of his death is 1624.

Gloucester Hall, founded in 1560 by Sir Thomas White, the founder of St John’s College. Its predecessor on the same site was Gloucester College, that was founded in 1283 by the Benedictine Abbey of St Peter at Gloucester and existed until the dissolution of the monasteries in 1539.
history.acquisition: Worcester College, Oxford. Gloucester Hall was re-founded as Worcester College in 1714.

recordHist.source: Elizabeth Solopova, Manuscripts of the Wycliffite Bible in the Bodleian and Oxford College Libraries, Exeter Medieval Texts and Studies (Liverpool: Liverpool University Press, 2016), no. 64.

listBibl.bibl: Ker, N. R., Fragments of medieval manuscripts used as pastedowns in Oxford bindings: with a survey of Oxford binding c.1515–1620 (Oxford: Printed for the Oxford Bibliographical Society by A. T. Broome, 1954), no. 1527, p. 140.
Dove, M., The first English Bible: the text and context of the Wycliffite versions (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2007), p. 303.
